page.title: 03Customs in Wootton Bassett
page.content: Every Saturday the Wootton Bassett {Town Crier}calls the news for people round the town.He is dressed in a long green coat,yellow socks,black triangular hat and calls attention with his bell. Every year certain people have the luck to be chosen as{Carnival Queen,Princess,Butterfly Queen or Attendants.They ride on a float in the procession and wear a red cloak and a silver crown. Our town celebrates{Coronations}and {Jubilees}by roasting an ox by the Town Hall.The High Street is closed for the day so they can organise games,street parties and processions. About a month before{Christmas}the Chamber of Trade put some coloured lights up round the town and Christmas trees round the Town Hall.The lights are switched on while carols are sung.
